Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a ship is set to sail in the sea, but no one can know its fate till the time it reaches the shore beyond.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ ik smuMdr ivc jhwj qor dyeIdw hY, pr jd qk pwr nhIˆ phuMcdw Brosw nhIˆ kIqw jwˆdw, aus dy shI slwmq pwr pu`jx dw[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qO ikRswn Kyq hyqu kir joqY bovY; mwnq kusl Awn pYTy igRh dÍwr kO [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a farmer happily and delightfully ploughs the field, sows the seed, but he celebrates his happiness only when the harvested grain is brought home.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ ik ikrswn ihq nwl Kyq vwhuMdw bIjdw hY pr suK qk mMndw hY jd Gr dy bUhy ivcoˆ lMGw ky Anwj AMdr ilAw rKdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ipr sMgm kY hoq gr hwr nwir; krq hY pRIq pyiK suq ky illwr kO [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a wife comes close to her husband to please him, but she considers her love a success only when she bears a son and he loves her.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ nwrI pqI imlwp leI iSMgwr krdI hY, pr ies nUM sPl qdy smJdI hY jdoˆ puqr dy m`Qy nUM dyK dyK ky ipAwrdI hY[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy ausqiq inMdw krIAY n kwhU kyrI; jwnIAY DO kYso idn AwvY AMq kwr kO [595[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Similarly, no one should be praised or slandered before time. Who knows what sort of a day may dawn in the end that all his labour may bear fruit or not. (One may tread a wrong path and wander or will be accepted by the Guru ultimately).  (595)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ ausqq inMdw iksy dI nhIˆ krnI cwhIdI, ikauˆik kI jwxIey ik EVk nUM idn kYsw Awvy Bwv kwmXwbI jwˆ nwkwmXwbI dw ]595]
